reviews.text: This is our 2nd time staying at the Colonial Hotel. Our son is a freshman at Fitchburg State University about 15 minutes down the road from the hotel. We booked a room in June when he had his freshman orientation and decided to stay here again for his Freshman move in day. Rooms are impeccable, the staff is very pleasant and there is a full service restaurant and bar onsite. We arrived after 9pm and had a very good meal of cajun prime rib and baked stuffed chicken. there is a complimentary breakfast in the morning that was more than I've seen at some major hotel chains. The decor is beautiful and reminds me an old time mansion complete with the spiral staircase as you walk in the main doors. There is a pool and jacuzzi on site but we did not check it out on either occasion. The beds are very comfortable and rooms generously sized for a double room. We plan to spend the weekend at the end of September for Family Weekend at my son's college here once again. So glad we found this hotel because we know that we'll be taking advantage of the close proximity to the college for the next four years...Wish they had a frequent guest reward program!
reviews.title: Step Back in time.. Hidden Gem

reviews.title: It's ok...

reviews.text: Writing this review is tough because I had my wedding reception at this hotel 10 years ago and enjoyed it. So, I was very excited to return to the hotel for this past Easter weekend for a three- night stay. We have 3 kids so booked the king room with pullout sofa. The room size was average size. My biggest complaint was the sofa mattress was HORRIBLE! We went to the front desk to see what could be done. Even housekeeping agreed it was worn out. The front desk had to check with management before they could offer us cots without being charged. I realize sofa mattresses aren't the most comfortable, but when you pushed down on this one, there was absolutely no cushion. My daughter thought it was a box springs. Also, found it strange the cots didn't have mattress pads on them. So, the room size was o.k. with the pullout sofa but once we added two cots to the mix, it got tight quick. And, the bathroom was small as well. You had to open the door then go behind it to close it. Water pressure was good though and the room was clean. I'm not sure the refrigerator worked in our room. O.K. for drinks but didn't trust it with milk. Nice size TV that pulled out so we could turn it. TV channels were limited but several showtime stations. I was very bummed they didn't offer NESN. The pool and gym were excellent. Towels in the room soft and in good condition. Free breakfast is included on weekdays but you have to pay on weekends. The Colonial Grill was great. In fact, I found the staff in the restaurant much more pleasant than the front desk staff. Have to say, the front desk staff was not friendly at all. Parking wasn't a problem and close to Route 2. I'm torn if I'd stay there again. Loved the indoor pool but wouldn't attempt to use the pull out sofas again. Would definitely visit the restaurant though - food was good and staff was awesome. On a side note, they don't allow you to bring in alcohol. Not a big deal but found the policy a little strange. I rated the value of this hotel "Average" because I had the AAA rate. I would have rated it "poor" had I paid the full rate. Hope this review helps.
reviews.title: Not many choices but this is the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A hidden gem! Our daughter got married here in August. We booked this venue well over a year I advance. Mary/Lindsey (wedding coordinators) do an awesome job. Everything went according to schedule, from the ceremony at the pergola to the reception in the beautiful new tent. We were able to continue the party in the bar area after the reception was over. The weather was just perfect. We had booked over 40 rooms for everyone. Buffet breakfast was added bonus for everyone.
reviews.title: Perfect place for outdoor wedding

reviews.text: I stayed at the Colonial Hotel for my best friend's wedding this past Friday. The mother of the bride drove an hour and half to the hotel to book their "Colonial Suite" a month before the wedding in person. The wedding was going to be at the Harding Allen Estate about 30 minutes away, and she wanted to make sure the bridal party could all get ready in the suite. She made sure to ask the front desk clerk if we could check in EARLY at 10 am, and was assured it was absolutely no problem. She booked the hotel and paid for it right there. It was very important that early check in was allowed because we had two hair dressers and a makeup artist driving up to meet us there.
reviews.title: HORRIFIC CUSTOMER SERVICE!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived Friday morning at 10 am with bags of stuff and our dresses, ready to get our hair and make up done. The woman at the front desk was already stressed out because the phones were ringing off the hook and she was the only one there. We explained that we were there to check in early to the Colonial Suite to get ready for a wedding. She rudely snapped back "well you can't check in early because there is someone staying in that room. Check out is not until 11 am and check in is not until 3 pm." The mother of the bride explained that this had been already arranged ahead of time and showed her the paperwork she had when she came to book the hotel. The woman at the desk said she did not know what to tell us because, again, there is someone currently in that suite. She also repeated the check in and check out times. She said that she doesn't know who said we could check in early, but that is not something they allow. She did not once apologize to us, instead, she made us feel like it was our problem and she wasn't going to do anything to help us. So the mother of the bride asked to speak to a manager. The woman promptly got on the phone and called her. They spoke back and fourth a bit and then the woman said that the manager will be right down to see us because we were not going to like what she was going to tell us.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: We were expecting someone to come down and be apologetic and offer a solution to our situation. Instead we got someone that was stuck up and even more rude than the woman at the front desk. We explained the story again. She did not apologize. She did not care that this was a bride on one of the most important days of her life. She did not care that we had all of our stuff there. She did not care that we had professionals meeting us to do our hair and make up. She did not care that someone at the hotel said this would be no problem. She did however repeat the check in and check out policy. She explained that they have their own weddings there that take preference to everyone else. And that she would most certainly not kick out these guests for us. Great, not only did you screw up, but now you are saying we are not important because our wedding is not at your venue. We were bringing them a TON of business. This wedding had 90 people attending, most all chose to stay at the Colonial. But I guess that didn't mean anything to her.
reviews.title: Sad!

reviews.text: We continued to go back and forth about the situation. She said that she would most certainly look into who told us that early check in was possible because it is not their policy to allow it. OK GREAT, WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO ABOUT IT NOW???! CUSTOMER SERVICE 101: Apologize!! And try to offer a solution to the problem!! I DON'T CARE IF IT IS OR IS NOT YOUR POLICY, SOMEONE AT YOUR HOTEL SAID IT WAS OK. SO FIX IT!!
reviews.title: Clean and Comfortable
TERRIBLE MANAGEMENT!!!!
reviews.text: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Colonial Hotel to attend a wedding. We called the week before to confirm, and made sure an early check-in would not be an issue.

reviews.title: Awesome time, great food, nice rooms!
reviews.text: We get there after driving two hours early, as we had discussed over the phone. As we walk in we are not greeted or thanked, but glared at for interrupting the desk clerk named Laurie Lovewell from whatever she was doing on the computer. Not even a smile! We explain our situation, and she very rudely says we will NOT be checking in early. At eight o clock in the morning, she tells us to come back at three. Does not care about the prior phone conversation, or the fact we just drive two hours to get there.

My husband and I drive around to kill some time, but return in a half an hour. Upon our return, we proceed to the lobby. The whole while hoping there is another representative available. No such luck. We explain the situation again, but we get nothing more than a snyde attitude. She says she is going to CHARGE US AN ENTIRE ADDITIONAL NIGHT for checking in early when we were told there would be no charge on the phone. My husband is exhausted and gives in thinking we can clear it up with the hotel manager herself. While giving us our keys she does not explain where the facilities are, breakfast, nothing. The ne thing she says to us? "THERE IS NO OUTSIDE BOOZE ALLOWED". Mind you, we don't even drink. We are a young couple who have very respectable corporate jobs, and have been married for six years.
reviews.title: Gorgeous hotel, amazing food, gym, heated indoor pool, & polite hotel staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I send our terrible experience to the manager, Nicole Moorshead, anticipating any form of solution. Nothing! She repeats what their check-in time is and what we were charged. No courtesy basket or refund as an apology for our treatment.
reviews.title: Good If You're There for an Event - But Beware of Rates!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at hotels all over. It is a regular thing for us, and we have NEVER HAD SUCH TERRIBLE SERVICE!! I am flabbergasted at the entire exchange, and would never stay here again. I would have had a better experience staying at a flea ridden Motel 6. Beware potential newlyweds who are looking to use this facility for the happiest day of your life. The service to your loved ones would not be what you deserve.
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay!
